contentrichtext.text: '''Rasputin''' commonly refers to [[Grigori Rasputin]] (1869–1916), a mystic for the Romanov dynasty during the Russian Empire. '''Rasputin''' may also refer to: {{TOC right}} == People == *[[Maria Rasputin]] (1898–1977), Grigori Rasputin's daughter *[[Valentin Rasputin]] (born 1937), Russian writer == Fictional characters == *Rasputin, a character in the graphic novel series, ''[[Corto Maltese]]'' *[[Rasputin (World Heroes)]], character in the videogame ''World Heroes'' *[[Grigori Rasputin (Hellboy)]], character in the graphic novel series, ''Hellboy'' *[[Mikhail Rasputin]], character in Marvel Comics series, ''X-Men'' *Piotr Rasputin, aka [[Colossus (comics)]], a character in Marvel Comics series, ''X-Men'' *Illyana Rasputina, aka [[Magik (comics)]], a character in Marvel Comics series, ''X-Men'' *[[Razputin]], character in the videogame ''Psychonauts'' *Rasputin, the Mad Frog; one of the Punk Frogs from the [[Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles]] series == In music == *[[Rasputin Music]], music chain in the San Francisco Bay Area of California *[[Rasputin (song)|"Rasputin" (song)]], disco song performed by the group Boney M *[[Rasputin (Turisas song)|"Rasputin" (Turisas song)]], cover of the Farian song "Rasputin" by the Finnish band Turisas *"Rasputin", 2008 single by British singer Jack Lucien on his album ''[[New 80s Musik]]'' *"Rasputin", a song by Cavalera Conspiracy from their 2011 album ''[[Blunt Force Trauma (album)|Blunt Force Trauma]]'' *''[[Rasputin - Miracles Lie in the Eye of the Beholder]]'', rock opera about Grigori Rasputin ==Films== * [[Rasputin (1938 film)|''Rasputin'' (1938 film)]], a French film directed by Marcel L'Herbier *''[[Rasputin, the Mad Monk]]'', a 1966 film about Grigori Rasputin *''[[Rasputin: Dark Servant of Destiny]]'', a 1996 HBO made-for-television film *[[Agony (film)|''Agony'' (film)]], a Soviet film by director Elem Klimov released in the U.S. as ''Rasputin'' *[[Rasputin (2011 film)|''Rasputin'' (2011 film)]], a 2011 film directed by Louis Nero * [[Rasputin (2013 film)|''Rasputin'' (2013 film)]], an upcoming Indian film ==Other== *[[Rasputin (novel)|''Rasputin'' (novel)]], as-yet uncompleted science fiction novel by Orson Scott Card and Kathryn H. Kidd == See also == *[[Rasputina (disambiguation)]] {{disambiguation|surname}} [[Category:Russian-language surnames]]
